thread.title: Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley in 'secret talks to host Blind Date' when matchmaking show returns to TV screens
thread.title_full: Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley in 'secret talks to host Blind Date' when matchmaking show returns to TV screens

author: Vicki Newman
title: Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley in 'secret talks to host Blind Date' when matchmaking show returns to TV screens
text:
Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley in 'secret talks to host Blind Date' when matchmaking show returns to TV screens The show is making a comeback on Channel 5 Share Catherine Tyldesley is apparently in the running to host Blind Date Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley could be the new Cilla Black. 
The blonde beauty is reportedly in talks to host Blind Date when it returns to TV screens. 
Catherine, who plays Eva Price in the ITV soap, could front the matchmaking show, according to the Daily Star. 
The programme is set to move to Channel 5 and Catherine has reportedly been in discussions with producers. 
The newspaper also says that the Corrie babe put herself forward for the hosting job after her co-star Helen Flanagan was rumoured to be in the running. Read More Blind Date bosses want Kylie Minogue to be 'the new Cilla Black' as show makes big comeback Catherine plays Eva in Corrie (Photo: ITV) 
An insider at the studios told the publication:"Cath is very keen to be the host of Blind Date. Everyone knows she would be the perfect package." 
The much-loved dating show was hosted by beloved Cilla for nearly two decades before she hung up her matchmaking heels in 2003 and the show was cancelled. 
It was initially thought former Geordie Shore babe Vicky Pattison was in the running to become the new host, and producers were then believed to have turned their attentions to Kylie Minogue. Vicky Pattison was also rumoured to be in the running for the job (Photo: Goff) 
Also said to be in the frame is singer Olly Murs, 32, as well as actresses Georgia May Foote, 25, and Helen Flanagan, 26. 
The show will be produced by So Television – which makes The Graham Norton Show – and Stellify Media - a company part-owned by Sony Pictures Television. 
It's expected to appeal to “a new generation of viewers” while keeping some of the “traditions of the past”. Helen Flanagan was thought to be up for the hosting role too (Photo: ITV) 
There’s likely to be six or eight episodes in the first series that will be shown on Friday nights. 
Just like the previous format, it revolves around three singletons hidden from the view of a member of the opposite sex who chooses them based on their answers – rather than their appearance. 
The new version will be up against ITV’s Take Me Out and Meet The Parents. 
Channel 5 would give no comment on who the host of the show will be. 
Mirror Celeb has contacted Catherine's representatives for comment. Like us on Facebook
